inclusion.criterion: Healthy subjects aged from 2 to 5 years old of normal intelligence.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects' guardians are able to understand and sign the informed consent.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient's guardians are not mentioned, but it can be assumed they are able to understand and sign the informed consent.

inclusion.criterion: Subjects established as healthy after medical history questioning, physical examination and clinical decision and in accordance with vaccination requirements of the investigational vaccine.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient was diagnosed with atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome and treated with plasma exchange and corticosteroids. This suggests that they have a pre-existing medical condition, but it is not clear if this would affect their eligibility for the trial.

inclusion.criterion: Subjects who can comply with the requirements of the clinical trial program according to the researcher's views.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Subjects who have never received group A, C polysaccharide meningococcal vaccine and type b haemophilus Influenzal vaccine.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient has been previously vaccinated with meningococcal group ACWY conjugate vaccine and meningococcal group B vaccine.

inclusion.criterion: Subjects with temperature <37°C on axillary setting.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subject who has a medical history of Meningitis;
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: The patient was diagnosed with atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome, not meningitis.

exclusion.criterion: Subject that has a medical history of any of the following: allergies, seizures, epilepsy, encephalopathy history and so on;
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Subject who is allergic with tetanus toxoid components;
exclusion.label: not_met
exclusion.evidence: There is no mention of the patient being allergic to tetanus toxoid components.

exclusion.criterion: Subject suffering from thrombocytopenia or other coagulation disorder may lead to contraindication to intramuscular injection;
exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: The patient's blood smear showed microangiopathic hemolytic anemia and thrombocytopenia.

exclusion.criterion: Subject who has a history of allergic reactions;
exclusion.label: unknown
not_met
exclusion.evidence: There is no mention of the patient having any known immunological dysfunction.

exclusion.criterion: Had received gamma globulin or immune globulin, in the past two weeks;
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a pre-existing medical condition (atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome) and was treated with plasma exchange and corticosteroids. This may affect their eligibility for the trial.
